name: Ibis Bristol Centre

reviews.text: I've stayed at this hotel several times with work previously without any issue, however I stayed here for two nights in December which turned into a nightmare.
reviews.title: Stay clear if you want a decent night's sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first night was ok and uneventful, however the second night, a Thursday, was anything but.
reviews.title: so nearly a 5 *

reviews.text: I was awoken at half two in the morning by other guests shouting in the corridor. After 15 minutes of this noise, I ventured out of my room and asked them to be quiet. There were four people in the corridor in various stages of drunkenness, shouting because they couldn't get in their room. I was greeted with several expletives and was told to f*** off. As the rooms don't have telephones it wasn't easy to advise reception/night manager of the issue.
reviews.title: Good hotel in nice area

reviews.text: I remonstrated with these 'people' of their noise and inconsideration to other guests only to be attacked by two of the women. I was left with scratches on my face and a bite mark on my arm (for which I've had tetanus and hepatitis B injections for) for my pleasure.
reviews.title: confused between the 2 ibis hotels!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have never been to Bristol before and needed a decent base for a family wedding. This was perfect for our 2 nights. The service when we arrived was prompt and efficient staff were helpful. I like a quiet room and thats what we got it was a long walk from the lift but well worth it. The room was clean and fresh and the bathroom was the same, tea and coffee available. The bed was clean and very comfortable which is the main part. When you opened the curtains, although we were on the 4th floor the people in the buildings accross could see in, to get dressed you had to close the curtains and it was dark. I mentioned this to reception and nets were up at the windows in 5 min :~) So it pays to ask .. When you come back late at night security man the door and wont let you in if you dont know your room number and name is on the list :~) helps if you can remember both ;~) HA ! can be tricky after a night out !!!
reviews.title: Very good value for money

reviews.text: The only negative was the breakfast - I think it was poor for £7.50 . The bacon was all fat and no meat, the eggs were like rubber and I noticed everyone left them on their plate. I mentioned it to the staff and they did make fresh eggs but they were over cooked again. There was however lots of other fresh continental stuff however for £7.50 I want the full works.
reviews.title: Unclean, and rather unfriendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking is very close but is a bit pricey - the hotel gets you a couple of pounds off
reviews.title: Simple, clean, convenient.
FANTASTIC
reviews.text: If like me you like a morning run it is great for a few miles along the water front.
All in all I really would choose to stay here again .
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: This hotel is well-located in the redeveloped harbourside area close to the centre of Bristol. Parking only available underground and quite pricey (discount from hotel) then short walk to hotel. Many dining options very close by and more a short walk away (NB Bristol has hills!) Rooms unremarkable but well-appointed, quiet and comfortable. Staff helpful and pleasant.
reviews.title: Ideal city centre stop

reviews.text: I booked this on a flexible rate that could be cancelled several days before my stay. I had to change my plans and cancelled several weeks in advance. I received my cancellation notification. Unfortunately I deleted that email in error, Imagine my horror when I was invoiced for my stay, the hotel will not/cannot look for the cancellation (why is it on a different number - surely my booking no should show cancelled) and head office have not had the decency to reply to my calls/emails to confirm my cancellation with the hotel.
reviews.title: Good luck if you've had to cancel - they still charge

reviews.text: So unless you pay in advance or are 100% sure of your plans then give this place a miss as it'll cost you.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Ok so it wasn't gorgeous, but on the whole it was fine. The rooms were compact, but perfectly acceptable for a short stay. Quite hot but as you can open the windows, no real problem. Bed was comfortable and since I had brought my own pillow I slept pretty well.
reviews.title: Never stayed in 2 star hotel before but it was ok!

reviews.text: Breakfast was ok too. Nothing a la carte and stayed away from the solidified scrambled eggs. Bacon, toast, fresh fruit and coffee are a good way to start the day.
reviews.title: Great Hotel at a great price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean, efficient, functional Hotel. Helpful staff and exceptional value. Room was clean and new, with en-suite andTea and coffee making facilities, TV etc exactly as stated. Just a short walk to Cabot Circus (10 min). To park you pull into the lay-by opposite and obtain a ticket from front desk. Parking is behind the Hotel on a pay and display car park which is well lit and covered by CCTV. £2.50 over-night (make sure you have the correct change). Will stay here again.
reviews.title: Good value and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for Friday and Saturday in February. The rate for the room was excellent value for money at £101 for the two nights on their "Winter deal". Reception staff seemed efficient, polite and helpful. Nothing we requested was too much trouble (extra pillow, extra towels and could we leave our cases for a while on the day of departure)
reviews.title: Great value, clean hotel

description: The Ibis Bristol Centre is located next to the historic Harbourside. Easily accessible from the airport via the M32 motorway, the hotel offers 182 rooms and features a reception open 24 hours, a restaurant and wireless Internet connection. A secure public carpark is available to guests at a reduced rate.
